titleStmt.title: R. W. Bush to William T. Scott
CWG13814

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Horse Settlements, Salaries, Ins. Bureau, Gen. Receipts, Correspondence Regarding Troops; Right Stack

body.p:
McFerran & Menefee,
Commission Merchants, Forwarders & Cotton Factors.
Louisville, July 8. 1865
Col. W T Scott
Dear Will

I drop you aline to say to you that Mr Triplet is here, he has signed the agreement between him and myself sent down here by you, he requist me to aske Gov- Bramlett to destroy or send to him the agreement which he sent to have filled up- he refuses to sell his remaining interest in the Gun, says he is perfectly willing to defray his proportion of the exspences of any Competent to go to Europe and dispose of it, to the interests of all concerned, he thinks it agood thing, and seems anxious that I should go, I told him frankly that my business was such that I could not leave without great sacrifice, & if I did inerst be paid liberally for my time & labortrouble, which he says he is willing to do, so we parted
